column4: There has been a resource intensive process running on my laptop  (Jaunty) for the last 3 hours.  Any ideas what this might be, or what logs I can check to find out?
top would generally show the culprit process.
thanks, it looks like w3m
it's a text-based web browser
VCoolio: thanks.  That can'be be eating all my resources... I'll keep checking.
which resources? memory? cpu cycles? hard disk space?
memory, cpu cycles, constant disk read/write.  it has slowed the responsiveness of the system to useless... almost like an indexing cron job or something.
how long has it been a problem?
Today, for the first time.  It's been going to three hours.
I want to track it down before I shut the machine down.
when you run top, which processes are hanging out at the top of the cpu usage list?
(besides top)
multiload-apple, chipcardd4, Xorg, w3m, gnome-terminal, kswapd0
if you kill w3m, do things improve?
Yeah, w3m was the culprit.  Any idea why?
depends on what pages it was viewing.
I never use it, is there a cron job that uses it?
not to my recollection
Thanks.  Mmmm... makes me wonder what just happened to my laptop?
probably nothing untoward. if it happens again, look to see how long the process has been running, and the username of the owner.
OK, Thanks again for the timely help :-)
no trouble
